meanings.sent1: The little sprog giggled happily in the park.
meanings.sent2: The newborn sprog slept soundly in the crib.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous sprog tried to eat their own toes.
meanings.sent4: The daycare was a sea of sprogs, each one a bundle of joy.
meanings.sent5: The sprog's laughter filled the room with pure delight.

meanings.definition: To give birth to or produce offspring.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit will sprog a litter of bunnies soon.
meanings.sent2: The apple tree sprogged many fruits this season.
meanings.sent3: The garden seemed to sprog new flowers overnight.
meanings.sent4: The factory line sprogged out toys at a rapid pace.
meanings.sent5: The hen proudly sprogged a dozen chicks.
